description.value:
Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by attackers who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate D (manipulate)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 1} (1 minute)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious] with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious] with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).
